item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Carolina Panthers wide receiver Steve Smith injures right shoulder after collision in practice
item.description: Panthers receiver Steve Smith has an injured right shoulder after a collision at practice.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: The Chicago White Sox acquire Alex Rios on waivers from Toronto Blue Jays
item.description: The Chicago White Sox acquire Alex Rios on waivers from Toronto Blue Jays.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Judge expected to hear Donte' Stallworth's request to reduce house arrest, probation
item.description: A Miami judge is expected to hear arguments on suspended Cleveland Browns wide receiver Donte' Stallworth's motion to cut his time on house arrest and probation, which were part of his DUI manslaughter plea bargain.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Cabbie's attorney says Patrick Kane incident overblown
item.description: The attorney for a cab driver who says he was beaten up by Patrick Kane and his cousin over pocket change said the incident had been blown out of proportion.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Tulowitzki hits for cycle as Rockies beat Cubs
item.description: Troy Tulowitzki hit for the cycle and had a career-high seven RBIs to help Colorado beat the Cubs 11-5 on Monday night.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Michael Schumacher ends Formula One comeback due to injuries from motorcycle crash
item.description: Michael Schumacher on Tuesday announced he has called off his much-anticipated Formula One comeback because of lingering injuries from a motorcycling crash earlier this year.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Boston Celtics re-sign free-agent power forward Glen 'Big Baby' Davis
item.description: The Celtics are bringing back Glen "Big Baby" Davis, announcing Monday that they've re-signed the power forward to a new deal. It's reportedly for two years.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: PGA Tour to fine Tiger Woods for criticizing rules official
item.description: Tiger Woods will be fined by the PGA Tour for his public criticism of a rules official after winning the Bridgestone Invitational, a tour official said.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Philadelphia Phillies to start Pedro Martinez vs. Chicago Cubs, put Jamie Moyer in bullpen
item.description: The Phillies announced that they will start Pedro Martinez Wednesday against the Cubs and send Jamie Moyer to the bullpen.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Tampa Bay Buccaneers' Antonio Bryant out for preseason with knee injury
item.description: Buccaneers receiver Antonio Bryant has a torn meniscus in his left knee that will sideline him for the remainder of training camp.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Chad Billingsley to miss start with strained hammy
item.description: Chad Billingsley will miss his next scheduled start with a strained hamstring.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: NBA free agents: Denver Nuggets forward Linas Kleiza takes Olympiakos' offer
item.description: Denver Nuggets forward Linas Kleiza is on his way to Greece after signing a two-year contract worth $12.2 million with Olympiakos on Monday.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Tony Stewart sets mark with 5th Watkins Glen victory
item.description: Tony Stewart has won the rain-delayed NASCAR Sprint Cup race at Watkins Glen International.

item.dc:creator: ESPNChicago.com
item.title: Major League Baseball is looking into comments made by Chicago White Sox manager Ozzie Guillen about retaliating against teams that hit his players
item.description: Major League Baseball is looking into comments made by Chicago White Sox manager Ozzie Guillen about retaliating against teams that hit his players.

item.dc:creator: Adam Rittenberg
item.title: Michigan State Spartans reinstate Glenn Winston following jail term
item.description: Michigan State has reinstated sophomore running back Glenn Winston, who was released from jail after serving four months for his role in an off-campus fight that seriously injured a Spartans hockey player.
